item.title: Santosh add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I never change, I simply become more myself." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Santosh add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Think you're escaping and run into yourself. Longest way round is the shortest way home." -- James Joyce

item.title: Santosh add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description:
"Aureliano not only understood by then, he also lived his brother’s experiences as something of his own, for on one occasion when the latter was explaining in great detail the mechanism of love, he interrupted him to ask: “What does it feel like?” José Arcadio gave an immediate reply:
“It’s like an earthquake." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Santosh add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "Books, which we mistake for consolation, only add depth to our sorrow. " -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Santosh add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "For if a lover's face survives emblazoned on your heart, the world is still your home." -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Santosh add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "Tell me then, does love make one a fool or do only fools fall in love?" -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Santosh add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "There is always something left to love." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Santosh add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "They were so close to each other that they preferred death to separation." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Santosh add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Intrigued by that enigma, he dug so deeply into her sentiments that in search of interest he found love, because by trying to make her love him he ended up falling in love with her." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Santosh add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Things have a life of their own," the gypsy proclaimed with a harsh accent. "It's simply a matter of waking up their souls." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Santosh add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Although some men who were easy with their words said that it was worth sacrificing one’s life for a night of love with such an arousing woman, the truth was that no one made any effort to do so. Perhaps, not only to attain her but also to conjure away her dangers, all that was needed was a feeling as primitive and as simple as that of love, but that was the only thing that did not occur to anyone." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Santosh add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Anyone who loves in the expectation of being loved in return is wasting their time." -- Paulo Coelho
